member.summary: implementation for the <circle> tag.

member.name: T:iText.Svg.Renderers.Impl.ClipPathSvgNodeRenderer
member.summary: This renderer represents a collection of elements (simple shapes and paths).
member.remarks: This renderer represents a collection of elements (simple shapes and paths). The elements are not drawn visibly, but the union of their shapes will be used to only show the parts of the drawn objects that fall within the clipping path. In PDF, the clipping path operators use the intersection of all its elements, not the union (as in SVG); thus, we need to draw the clipped elements multiple times if the clipping path consists of multiple elements.

member.name: F:iText.Svg.Renderers.Impl.PathSvgNodeRenderer.SPLIT_PATTERN
member.summary: The regular expression to split the PathData attribute of the <path> element
member.remarks:
The regular expression to split the PathData attribute of the <path> element
Since
is called before the use of this expression in
the attribute to be split is valid. SVG defines 6 types of path commands, for a total of 20 commands: MoveTo: M, m LineTo: L, l, H, h, V, v Cubic Bezier Curve: C, c, S, s Quadratic Bezier Curve: Q, q, T, t Elliptical Arc Curve: A, a ClosePath: Z, z

member.summary: Implements elliptical curveTo (A) segment of SVG's path element.
member.remarks: Implements elliptical curveTo (A) segment of SVG's path element. Implemented in PDF as Bzier curves. Edge cases & value correction below always refer to https://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/implnote.html#ArcImplementationNotes For some calculations we need double precision floating point math, so we have forced all calculations to use double. However, float comparison is used instead of double comparison, because close coordinates can be considered equal.

member.returns: the list of rotated points

member.name: T:iText.Svg.Renderers.Path.Impl.EllipticalCurveTo.EllipseArc
member.summary: Converts between two types of definitions of an arc: The input is an arc defined by two points and the two semi-axes of the ellipse.
member.remarks: Converts between two types of definitions of an arc: The input is an arc defined by two points and the two semi-axes of the ellipse. The output is an arc defined by a bounding rectangle, the starting angle, and the angular extent of the ellipse that is to be drawn. The output is an intermediate step to calculating the Bzier curve(s) that approximate(s) the elliptical arc, which happens in .

member.name: T:iText.Svg.Renderers.Path.Impl.IControlPointCurve
member.summary: Interface that describes a Path object which is defined by control points.
member.remarks:
Interface that describes a Path object which is defined by control points. In practice this only means Bzier curves, both quadratic (one control point) and cubic (two control points). This interface is relevant in the context of Smooth (Shorthand) Bzier curves, which omit a control point from their arguments list because it can be calculated from the last control point of the previous curve. Therefore, the last control point of a curve must be exposed to the
algorithm.

member.summary: Returns coordinates of the last control point (the one closest to the ending point) in the Bezier curve, in SVG space coordinates
member.returns: coordinates of the last control point in SVG space coordinates

specifically for smooth curves. It will convert all operators from relative to absolute coordinates except the first coordinate pair. This implementation is used by the Smooth (Shorthand) Bzier curve commands, because the conversion of the first coordinate pair is calculated in .

member.name: T:iText.Svg.Utils.TransformUtils
member.summary: Utility class responsible for converting Strings containing transformation declarations into AffineTransform objects.
member.remarks:
Utility class responsible for converting Strings containing transformation declarations into AffineTransform objects.
This class only supports the transformations as described in the SVG specification: - matrix - rotate - scale - skewX - skewY - translate

member.name: F:iText.Svg.Utils.TransformUtils.MATRIX
member.summary: Keyword for matrix transformations.
member.remarks:
Keyword for matrix transformations. Accepts 6 values.
matrix(0 1 2 3 4 5)

member.name: F:iText.Svg.Utils.TransformUtils.ROTATE
member.summary: Keyword for rotation transformation.
member.remarks:
Keyword for rotation transformation. Accepts either 1 or 3 values. In the case of 1 value, x and y are assumed to be the origin of the user space.
rotate(angle x y) rotate(angle)

member.name: F:iText.Svg.Utils.TransformUtils.SCALE
member.summary: Keyword for scale transformation.
member.remarks:
Keyword for scale transformation. Accepts either 1 or 2 values. In the case of 1 value, the second value is assumed to be the same as the first one.
scale(x y) scale(x)

member.name: F:iText.Svg.Utils.TransformUtils.SKEWX
member.summary: Keyword for skewX transformation.
member.remarks:
Keyword for skewX transformation. Accepts 1 value.
skewX(angle)

member.name: F:iText.Svg.Utils.TransformUtils.SKEWY
member.summary: Keyword for skewY transformation.
member.remarks:
Keyword for skewY transformation. Accepts 1 value.
skewY(angle)

member.name: F:iText.Svg.Utils.TransformUtils.TRANSLATE
member.summary: Keyword for translate transformation.
member.remarks:
Keyword for translate transformation. Accepts either 1 or 2 values. In the case of 1 value, the y value is assumed to be 0.
translate(x y) translate(x)

member.name: M:iText.Svg.Utils.TransformUtils.ParseTransform(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string containing a transform declaration into an AffineTransform object.
member.remarks: Converts a string containing a transform declaration into an AffineTransform object. This class only supports the transformations as described in the SVG specification: - matrix - translate - skewx - skewy - rotate - scale
member.returns: the AffineTransform object

member.name: M:iText.Svg.Utils.TransformUtils.SplitString(System.String)
member.summary: A transformation attribute can encompass multiple transformation operation (e.g. "translate(10,20) scale(30,40)".
member.remarks: A transformation attribute can encompass multiple transformation operation (e.g. "translate(10,20) scale(30,40)". This method splits the original transformation string into multiple strings so that they can be handled separately.
member.returns: a list containing strings describing a single transformation operation
